rationale: The agent modified the completely wrong file. Ground truth changes CrossClusterSigningConfigReloaderIntegTests.java in the testValidationFailsWhenUpdateWithInvalidPath method, replacing hardcoded Unix paths '/unknown/path' with createTempDir().resolve('unknown_file'). The agent instead modified CrossClusterApiKeySignerTests.java, adding complex keystore copying logic that was never requested. This is a critical failure: the agent did not address the task at all, modified an unrelated test file, and introduced unnecessary complexity (30+ lines of stream copying code) when the task only required replacing two hardcoded path strings with createTempDir() calls. The agent's changes are functionally unrelated to the bug described (hardcoded Unix paths failing on Windows in the signing config reloader test). No documentation was added, so no penalty there. The complete mismatch in file and functionality warrants maximum negative scores for correctness and completeness.
